result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor C Laporte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail previously posted ($250) to be applied to restitution. Balance of restitution for Victim A and Victim B to be paid within a reasonable amount of time after being release from custody.
Straight time. Concurrent with any current sentence. 1 day credit.

Court imposes a 4 day sentence in lieu of standard court costs ($243), DRGOD surcharge ($10), and DNA surcharge ($200). Sentence is to be served concurrent with any current sentence but consecutive to the sentence in Count 1.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Amended Plea questionnaire, waiver of rights with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:34 AM Defendant Trevor C Laporte by Zoom (phone), in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
150 Days Jail - straight time.  (Credit - 1 day).  CONCURRENT with any current sentence.

RESTITUTION: $ 1078.00 (jointly and severally liable) to be paid to Victims A and B within a reasonable amount of time after being released from custody.

COSTS: $ 243.00

DR GOD Surcharge: $ 10.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Cash bail to be applied.  Remaining costs and surcharges to be paid forthwith.   Failure to pay: will result 4 days Jail CONSECUTIVE to sentence in Count 1 but CONCURRENT with any current sentence.  Court imposes the alternate.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/bb guns.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
